h:head.h:title: Pediatric Behavioral Health Digital Toolkit Screening Measures

input.label: Your Age
input.hint: If less than 18 years old; Stop here; Only greater than or equal to 18 years of age is qualified">

select1.label: Are you the primary caregiver and living with the child?"
Is this the first time you are signing up for using the Digital Toolkit?

input.label: FBO ID:
Family ID:
Child ID:
Child’s Age in Years:
Child’s Age in Months:

select1.label: Attend school or early childhood care:

input.label: If in primary school, which grade:
Number of children at home:
Number of adults at home:

select1.label: Your gender:
Your relationship with the child:

input.label: Specify other relationship with the child

select1.label: What is Your Religion:

input.label: Specify other Religion

select1.label: Your highest education:
Marital Status:

item.label: Not married but live with a partner

input.label: Specify other Marital status

group.label: In today’s discussion, we will talk about……. your child’s behaviors and relationship; your parenting approaches and strategies; and your family relationship and resources to support your child/children.

input.hint: A child’s growth is like a tree. There are five areas of child development (including social, emotional, behavioral, physical, and academic/learning). To support a strong tree, the child needs to have adequate nutrition, which is usually provided by parents and family members. All the areas listed in this picture are inter-related. For this part of the interview, I am going to ask you questions from each area. We will look at the results together after you have answered all the questions

input.label: In the past month, please describe………

select1.label: How often has your child tried to stop a fight or argument
How often has your child shared candies and extra food
How often has your child helped other children who are feeling sick
How often has your child comforted a child who is crying or upset
How often has your child clapped or smiled if someone else does something well

input.label: In the past month, please describe……….

select1.label: How often your child has been left out by other children
How often other children have refused to let your child play with them
How often your child has been teased and made fun of by other children
How often your child has been pushed or shoved around by other children

input.label: For each of the following statement, please tell me how much it is like your child…
input.hint: 0 = Does not do this at all, 1 = Does this a little, 2 = Does this quite a bit, 3 = Does this a lot

item.label: Does not do this at all

select1.label: Participates in family activities

item.label: Does not do this at all

select1.label: Complies with rules at home

item.label: Does not do this at all

select1.label: Participates in church or religion activities

item.label: Does not do this at all

select1.label: Interacts positively with siblings

item.label: Does not do this at all

select1.label: Interacts positively with parents

item.label: Does not do this at all

select1.label: Trust a significant person with his or her life

item.label: Does not do this at all

select1.label: Asks for help

item.label: Does not do this at all

select1.label: Discusses problems with others

item.label: Does not do this at all

input.label: Please indicate how often or true the behavior is of your child
input.hint: 0= Never or Not True, 2 = Sometimes or Somewhat True, 3 = Often or Very True

select1.label: Has temper tantrums or hot temper
Argues a lot with adults
Argues a lot with peers
Blames others for his or her own mistakes
Is easily annoyed by others
Is angry and resentful
Gets back at people
Swears or uses curse words
Does things that annoy others

input.label: Please indicate how often or true the behavior is typical of your child…
input.hint: 0 = Never or Not True, 1 = Sometimes or Somewhat True, 2 = Often or Very True

select1.label: Worries about things in the future
Worries about past behavior
Worries about doing better at things
Is self-conscious or easily embarrassed
Needs to be told over and over that things are okay
Is nervous, high strung or tense

input.label: Please indicate how often or true the behavior is typical of your child…
input.hint: 0 = Never or not true, 1 = Sometimes or somewhat true, 2 = Often or very true

select1.label: Feels worthless or inferior
Is unhappy, sad or depressed
Is underactive, slow-moving, or lacks energy
Cries a lot
Seems lonely
Doesn't smile or laugh much
Withdraws from peer activities

input.label: Please give your answers based on how well your child can ……
input.hint: 0=Not at all, 1= A little, 2= Moderately well, 3=Well, 4=Very well

select1.label: Accept things not going his/her way
Cope with failure
Think before acting
Calm down when excited
Do what he/she is told
Control temper when in the face of disagreement

input.label: Please respond to how much each statement describes your child based on the past 7 days:
input.hint: 1=Not at all, 2=A little, 3=Somewhat, 4=Quite a bit, 5=very much

select1.label: My child was happy, cheerful, joyful
My child was strong
My child was proud/confident
My child was persistent/determined

input.label: Overall Health
input.hint: 1= Poor; 2= Not very good; 3= Good; 4= Very Good/Excellent

select1.label: Would you say your child’s health is…

input.label: Overall Health

select1.label: Compared with other children of his/her age, would you say your child falls sick easily?

input.label: Sleep Related Impairment - In the past 7 days……

select1.label: My child was sleepy during the daytime
My child had a hard time concentrating because he/she was sleepy
My child had a hard time getting things done because he/she was sleepy
My child had problems during the day because of poor sleep

input.label: Special Needs

select1.label: Does your child have any serious delay in sitting, standing or walking?
Does your child appear in any way mentally backward, dull or slow?

input.label: Academic Learning - Please rate how often does your child do each of the following thing

select1.label: My child pays attention when given instructions for assignment or activities
My child shows interest in learning new things
My child enjoys learning new things from older children or adults
My child copes well with the assignments set in school
My child enjoys the school
My child makes lots of mistakes when doing minor assignments or homework

input.label: Nurturing Parenting - When your child behaves well or does a good job at something, how often do you do each of the following things……

select1.label: Praise or compliment your child
Give your child a hug, kiss, pat, handshake, thumbs up or “high five”
Give him/her something (such as a stickers, a small toy) or give him/her money for good behavior
Give him/her a special or an extra privilege (such extra play time, go to the movies, special activity for good behavior)

input.label: Nurturing Parenting - When your child misbehaves, how often do you do each of the following things………

select1.label: Take away privileges (such as forbid him/her to do something he/she likes; playing sport)
Ignore misbehavior that is non-disruptive
Give him a time-out (e.g., put him/her in a separate quiet place but remain in the room so you can watch him/her)
Warn of consequences for misbehavior (e.g., loss of privileges).
Give him/her something else to do to redirect misbehaviors
Find out what made my child misbehave
Discuss the problem with him/her or ask questions.
Help my child deal with the issue that made him/her misbehave
Label (describe) his/her feelings (e.g., anger) related to misbehavior

input.label: Nurturing Parenting - In general, how often do you do the following things………

select1.label: Help your child use distraction, relaxation, or positive self-talk coping strategies to calm down him/her emotion and feel better
Make things fun (e.g., use song and games) to help your child follow directions
Give clear, positive directions when asking your child to do something

input.label: Nurturing Parenting - Over the past month, when your child has shown negative emotion (such as showing anger, sadness or frustration), how often have you done the following things………

select1.label: I have helped my child deal with the issue that made him/her angry or sad
I have comforted my child

input.label: Involvement in Education - Over the last 2 days,……
input.hint: 1=Less than 1/2 hour; 2=0.5-1 hours; 3= 1-1.5 hours; 4= 1.5-2 hours; 5=2-2.5 hours; 6= 2.5-3 hours; 7= 3 or more hours.

select1.label: 1. How many hours in total have you had any learning activities with your child (such as spend time talking about learning or school activities, doing reading together, telling stories, doing homework, etc.)

input.label: Involvement in Education - Over the last 2 days,……
input.hint: 1= Never; 2=Once; 3=Twice; 4= 3 times; 5= 4 or 5 times; 6=6 or 7 times; 7=more than 7 times

select1.label: 2. Have you done any non-school-type activities with your child (such as going some places for fun, playing, working on a hobby or craft, etc.)?

input.label: Household Rules - Please rate how much you agree or disagree with the following statements.

select1.label: I have made clear rules or expectations for my child about doing chores (such as putting away toys)
I have made clear rules or expectations for my child about not fighting, stealing, and lying
I have made clear rules or expectations for my child about going to bed and getting up on time
I have made clear rules or expectations for my child about the time for doing academic learning activities (such as reading, homework, practicing letter writing)

input.label: Inappropriate Strategies - When my child misbehaves or shows negative emotion, how often do you do each of the following things………

select1.label: Raise your voice (scold, shout, or yell).
Get your child to correct the problem or make up for his/her mistake.
Threaten to punish him/her, without following through with a punishment.
Spanked, hit or slapped him/her with bare hand.
Hit him/her using a stick, belt, or other hard object.
Called him/her dumb, lazy, or another name like that.

input.label: Effective/Competent Parenting -

select1.label: Is the discipline you use effective for your child (does it work?)
When you punish your child, does his behavior get better?

input.label: Effective/Competent Parenting -
input.hint: (1) Much harder than I expected; (2) Somewhat harder than I expected; (3) About as hard as I expected; (4) Somewhat easier than I expected; (5) much easier than I expected.

item.label: About as hard as I expected

select1.label: I found that getting my child to do something or stop doing something is:

item.label: About as hard as I expected

input.label: Effective/Competent Parenting -
input.hint: (1) Not very good at being a parent; (2) A person who has some trouble being a parent; (3) an average parent; (4) A better than average parent; (5) A very good parents

item.label: Not very good at being a parent
A person who has some trouble being a parent

select1.label: I feel that I am:

item.label: Not very good at being a parent
A person who has some trouble being a parent

input.label: Family Relationship and Support - General Functioning (Supportive Relationships, Problem solving and emotional expression). Please read each statement and decide how well it describes your family

select1.label: Planning family activities is difficult because we misunderstand each other
In time of crisis, we can turn to each other for support. (REVERSE CODE)
Individuals are accepted for what they are. (REVERSE CODE)
We avoid discussing our fears and concerns.
There are lots of bad feelings in the family.
We are able to make decisions about how to solve problems. (REVERSE CODE)

input.label: Resilience and Positive Focus - Please read each statement and indicate the extent to which it is true for your family. There are no right or wrong answers. Please give your honest opinion and feelings.
input.hint: 0=Not at all like my family, 1= Not much like my family, 2= Like my family, 3= almost always like my family

item.label: Not at all like my family

select1.label: We believe that something good comes out of the worst situations.

item.label: Not at all like my family

select1.label: If something beyond our control is constantly upsetting to our family, we find things to do that keep our minds off our worries.

item.label: Not at all like my family

select1.label: No matter what happens in our family, we try to look “at the bright side of things.”

item.label: Not at all like my family

select1.label: If we have a problem or concern that seems overwhelming, we try to forget it for a while.

item.label: Not at all like my family

input.label: Parental Wellbeing - Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems
input.hint: 0=Not at all; 1= several days, 2= More than half the days, 3=Nearly everyday

select1.label: Feeling nervous, anxious or on edge
Not being able to stop or control worrying
Little interest or pleasure in doing things
Feeling down, depressed or hopeless

select.label: Child Behavior Set - Please review sets of pictures and select those that are like your child, you (parent), and your family
Parenting Behavior Set - Please review sets of pictures and select those that are like your child, you (parent), and your family
Please review sets of pictures and select those that are like your child, you (parent), and your family
